confession.devil_appearance: visitor who struck him and vanished
confession.seduction_date: 2 years after passage of Bouillon's army (approximately 7-8 years before trial)
confession.seduction_context: Approached when angered by losses including 18 cattle and illness which lasted a year. Visitor offered to replace lost beasts. First time he commended himself to God and the visitor struck him and vanished. Reappeared a year later when guarding horses and lamenting that one was sick; offered him money, and this time he agreed to renounce God. Money turned out to be oak leaves.
powder_types: powder for killing persons and animals

testimony.quarrel_subject: Her son had better of a fight with son of accused
testimony.threat_quote: accused reported to have said he would not recover

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: developed pain under arm and died in 2 or 3 days

witnesses.name: Nicolas Mongein, fils feu Claudon Mongin
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: son of person who quarreled with accused

testimony.quarrel_subject: Father had numerous quarrels with him, to point of fighting with him
Son had fight with son of accused

witnesses.name: François le gros Henry
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: nephew by marriage (son-in-law of accused's grandfather Nicolas Margeron)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dispute over inheritance - Mathieu wanted a horse that came to witness's mother
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle l'auroit mais qu'elle n'en feroit grand proffit

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 11 years earlier, load slipped when Mathieu went by, never able to bring load safely to town until after wife's delivery

testimony.quarrel_subject: Mathieu had her husband summoned to justice at Blamont, then begged mercy saying it was his wife's insistence, but hatred continued
testimony.threat_quote: wife of accused told child 'luy faire sa saulce aupres dudit Margeron'

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after passage of Bouillon's army, all died, reduced to single cow
harms_alleged.harm_description: Could not raise calves, all died
Strange malady which made them delirious

witnesses.name: Demenge Breton, natif de Leintrey
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: son of person who quarreled with accused

testimony.quarrel_subject: Mathieu quarreled with his late father Didier Jean Breton

witnesses.name: Margueritte soeur Messire Dieudonné Claudon, curé de Leintrey

testimony.quarrel_subject: Said publicly he would give money to have Mathieu arrested
Quarrel about work arrangement and insult about Mathieu's mother (who was hanged as witch)
testimony.threat_quote: Bien, bien, tu verra combien tu en gagneras, ce que tu en gagneras tu le mettras en ta bourse

witnesses.name: Jean Breton, fils feu Didier Jean Breton
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: son of person who quarreled with accused

testimony.quarrel_subject: Crossed Mathieu's fallow field while carting stones, Mathieu threatened to take them to court at Blamont

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 7 or 8 weeks later, died in 24 hours

witnesses.name: Germain Hans Germain
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: official, his first wife quarreled with accused's wife

testimony.quarrel_subject: His first wife Margueritte Claudon Claude quarreled and fought with Mathieu's wife Margueritte, went to law at Blamont
testimony.threat_quote: que dans bien peu de temps elle se donroit garde de leur dispute ou bien quelqu'un de sa race

timeline.subject: Mathieu Margeron
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses, generally denied accusations

timeline.subject: Mathieu Margeron
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for question extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Mathieu Margeron
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture, confessed after being racked

timeline.subject: Mathieu Margeron
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Mathieu Margeron
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence, subject to final repetition of confessions

timeline.subject: Mathieu Margeron
timeline.details: Executed, withdrew accusations against Poirson le Petit Poirson and wife of Jacquot Sernay

accomplices_named.name: Pierson fils de Petit Pierson
accomplices_named.context: Named as accomplice at sabbat, later withdrew accusation

accomplices_named.name: le Petit Noel
accomplices_named.context: Named as accomplice at sabbat, wanted to make hail

accomplices_named.name: wife of Jacquot Sernay
accomplices_named.context: Named as accomplice at sabbat, later withdrew accusation

notable_quotes.speaker: Mathieu's wife Margueritte
notable_quotes.french: luy faire sa saulce aupres dudit Margeron
notable_quotes.context: Wife of accused told child of Jean Claudon Claude

notable_quotes.speaker: Mathieu Margeron (according to first husband of Meline)
notable_quotes.french: au contraire luy crioit mercy, et dit que sans l'importunité de sa femme il n'en fut ja venu en avant
notable_quotes.context: When summoned to justice at Blamont, begged mercy saying it was wife's insistence

notable_quotes.speaker: Mathieu Margeron
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle l'auroit mais qu'elle n'en feroit grand proffit
notable_quotes.english: she would have it but would not profit much from it
notable_quotes.context: About horse in inheritance dispute with François le gros Henry's mother

notable_quotes.speaker: Colas (Mathieu's son)
notable_quotes.french: que de sa part il ne s'en soucioit poinct, et que quant a luy il en feroit bien
notable_quotes.english: that for his part he didn't care about it, and as for him he would make it well
notable_quotes.context: Speaking about hail to sister of curé

notable_quotes.speaker: Mathieu Margeron
notable_quotes.french: Jehenne, tu te veindras plaindre a ta tante Margueritte, mais il y aura ung homme qui ne s'en souciera guiere
notable_quotes.context: To bride at wedding feast for François le Gros Henry at Frumenil

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Mathieu, son of la Grande Marie
notable_quotes.french: A quoy n'estoit il que je ne fasse prendre le plus gros Genox ou sorcier qui soit a Leintrey, declairant que sy l'on luy vouloit donner chacun six gros ou un franc qu'il le feroit prendre
notable_quotes.english: Why is it that I don't have the biggest Genox or sorcerer in Leintrey arrested, declaring that if someone would give him six gros or one franc each, he would have him arrested

notable_quotes.speaker: Mathieu Margeron
notable_quotes.french: Bien, bien, tu verra combien tu en gagneras, ce que tu en gagneras tu le mettras en ta bourse
notable_quotes.english: Well, well, you will see how much you will gain from it, what you gain you will put in your purse
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Michiel Hellenix after quarrel

notable_quotes.speaker: Michiel Hellenix about Mathieu's wife
notable_quotes.french: qu'il avoit desja usé de quelques paroles contre son mari Jusques a avoir dit qu'il n'avoit pas encore esté arrachée la cuisse de sa mere (pendue qu'elle estoit a une fourche proche de Manonviller)
notable_quotes.context: Reference to Mathieu's mother who was hanged as a witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Mathieu Margeron
notable_quotes.french: qu'un homme qui croit verroit merveille
notable_quotes.english: that a man who believes will see marvels
notable_quotes.context: Talking with Michiel Hellenix about wife's relatives

notable_quotes.speaker: François le Gros Henry
notable_quotes.french: que telles menasses tendoient au fait de sortilege
notable_quotes.english: that such threats tended toward witchcraft

notable_quotes.speaker: Mathieu Margeron
notable_quotes.french: qu'avant qu'il fut trois ans, ce qu'il en gagneroit, il en mettroit en sa bourse
notable_quotes.english: that before three years, what he would gain from it, he would put in his purse
notable_quotes.context: Threat to nephew François le Gros Henry

notable_quotes.speaker: Germain Hans Germain's first wife threat
notable_quotes.french: que dans bien peu de temps elle se donroit garde de leur dispute ou bien quelqu'un de sa race
notable_quotes.english: that in very little time she would beware of their dispute or someone of her race
notable_quotes.context: Mathieu's threat after legal settlement at Blamont

notable_quotes.speaker: Mathieu Margeron in interrogation
notable_quotes.french: lors qu'un homme se rejouissoit de quelque chose, c'estoit alors qu'il ne l'avoit point
notable_quotes.english: when a man rejoiced about something, it was then that he did not have it
notable_quotes.context: Denying he said child would not recover

notable_quotes.speaker: Mathieu Margeron under torture
notable_quotes.context: When first approached by devil, he commended himself to God

notable_quotes.speaker: Mathieu Margeron under torture
notable_quotes.french: et a bien tasché par plusieurs fois de se depetrir de ce malheur Mais jamais n'en a peu trouver les moyens
notable_quotes.english: and tried many times to extricate himself from this misfortune but never could find the means
notable_quotes.context: Describing being deceived by devil with oak leaves as money

notable_quotes.speaker: Mathieu Margeron about sabbat
notable_quotes.french: que les uns dansoient et les autres faisoient de grands appareils, toutesfois que tout cela n'estoit que pauvreté et abus
notable_quotes.english: that some danced and others made great preparations, however all that was only poverty and deception
notable_quotes.context: Describing what they did at sabbat

economic_context.details: Multiple inheritance disputes mentioned: division of Nicolas Margeron's succession, dispute with Nicolas Menusier over inheritance documents that 'plus advantagé ses premiers enfans que ladite Margueritte'. Mathieu wanted a horse from inheritance that went to François le gros Henry's mother. François le Gros Henry reduced to poverty after accused's threats.

historical_context.military_details: Passage of Bouillon's army mentioned multiple times as temporal marker and cause of economic losses. Mathieu was seduced by devil 2 years after passage of Bouillon's army when angered by losses including 18 cattle and illness.

illness of accused lasting a year
Meline and husband reduced to keeping single cow
François le Gros Henry reduced to great poverty from good means
could not raise calves after army passage

extraction_metadata.notes: Very detailed trial with 14 witnesses. Strong pattern of quarrel-threat-harm sequences. Accused had extensive family history of witchcraft (mother died in prison, sister executed). Multiple inheritance disputes and economic conflicts. Military context (Bouillon's army) important temporal and economic marker. Confession obtained only under torture (rack). Withdrew some accusations at execution. Property confiscation and distribution well documented.
